SEARCH
Package farm.sales

Class ReceiptPrinter

Object
ReceiptPrinter
public class ReceiptPrinter extends Object
Utility class for pretty-printing a transaction as a receipt. Essentially a wrapper around an unusually complex toString, to avoid clutter.
Please note that there is absolutely no requirement for you to understand the private methods used in this class, so long as you can call the public methods with the correct arguments, which you should be able to do from looking at the Javadocs alone. You are of course more than welcome to poke around in the helper methods if you are curious, but you are not expected to.
(provided)

    • createActiveReceipt

      public static String createActiveReceipt()
      Creates a placeholder receipt for a transaction that has not been finalised yet and therefore cannot be used to generate a true receipt.
      Returns:
      the placeholder receipt to display.

    • createReceipt

      public static String createReceipt(List<String> headings, List<List<String>> entries, String total, String customerName)
      Creates a nicely formatted String representation of a finalised transaction by styling it as a paper receipt, used for displaying information about this transaction to the CLI.

      The method works by accepting provided string components and placing them in the appropriate locations to create the final receipt. Specifically, these components should be provided as follows:

      1. Headings: Provide the headings to be displayed at the top of the 'purchases' section of the receipt, in the order (from left to right) in which they should appear on the receipt. For example, if a headings list is provided beginning with "Name", then the leftmost heading of the products section will be "Name". All headings will always appear on the same line.
      2. Entries: Provide a list of the entries to be displayed in the body of the 'purchases' section, beneath the provided headings. Each entry should be a list of strings, with each item in the list being the piece of information corresponding to the heading at the same index.
        For example, if the first heading in the headings list is "Name", and the first list in the entries list is ["Milk", "$4.40"], then "Milk" is the piece of information corresponding to the "Name" heading in the first entry.
        Each entry occupies its own line, unless that entry contains more items than there are headings; in this case, the entry 'wraps around' to the next line. For example, if there are two headings and some entry contains three items, then the third string in that entry would instead be shown at the start of the next line.
      3. Total: The string to be displayed as the total cost of the whole transaction.
      4. Customer name: The string to be displayed as the customer's name.
      Note: This method makes no changes to the formatting of any of the supplied strings. All supplied strings must already be in the format in which they are to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      headings - the headings to be shown at the top of all purchases listed on the receipt
      entries - the entries to be displayed in the purchases section of the receipt. Each entry is a list of strings that will be displayed in the same column as the headings at the corresponding index of the headings list.
      total - the total price reported on the receipt.
      customerName - the name of the customer reported on the receipt.
      Returns:
      the styled receipt representation of the provided transaction information

    • createReceipt

      public static String createReceipt(List<String> headings, List<List<String>> entries, String total, String customerName, String totalSaved)
      Creates a nicely formatted String representation of a finalised transaction by styling it as a paper receipt, used for displaying information about this transaction to the CLI.

      The method works by accepting provided string components and placing them in the appropriate locations to create the final receipt. Specifically, these components should be provided as follows:

      1. Headings: Provide the headings to be displayed at the top of the 'purchases' section of the receipt, in the order (from left to right) in which they should appear on the receipt. For example, if a headings list is provided beginning with "Name", then the leftmost heading of the products section will be "Name". All headings will always appear on the same line.
      2. Entries: Provide a list of the entries to be displayed in the body of the 'purchases' section, beneath the provided headings. Each entry should be a list of strings, with each item in the list being the piece of information corresponding to the heading at the same index.
        For example, if the first heading in the headings list is "Name", and the first list in the entries list is ["Milk", "$4.40"], then "Milk" is the piece of information corresponding to the "Name" heading in the first entry.
        Each entry occupies its own line, unless that entry contains more items than there are headings; in this case, the entry 'wraps around' to the next line. For example, if there are two headings and some entry contains three items, then the third string in that entry would instead be shown at the start of the next line.
      3. Total: The string to be displayed as the total cost of the whole transaction.
      4. Customer name: The string to be displayed as the customer's name.
      5. Total saved: The string to be displayed as the total savings incurred from the whole transaction.
      Note: This method makes no changes to the formatting of any of the supplied strings. All supplied strings must already be in the format in which they are to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      headings - the headings to be shown at the top of all purchases listed on the receipt
      entries - the entries to be displayed in the purchases section of the receipt. Each entry is a list of strings that will be displayed in the same column as the headings at the corresponding index of the headings list.
      total - the total price reported on the receipt.
      customerName - the name of the customer reported on the receipt.
      totalSaved - the total savings reported on the receipt.
      Returns:
      the styled receipt representation of the provided transaction information
